comment.author: 25438769@N07
comment._content: The title does not seem to be right. I doubt these are "Miss" anything

comment.author: 79805426@N00
comment._content: The two men labelled "Miss" represented Mississippi in Congress.  Harrison served in both houses, Vardaman was a senator.

comment.author: 30085166@N00
comment._content: Byron Patton Harrison (1881-1941) was a Mississippi Democrat who was a member of the U.S. House of Representatives from 1912 to 1919, and of the U.S. Senate from 1919 until his death. Biographical Directory of the U.S. Congress. James Kimble Vardaman (1861-1930) was a former Mississippi Governor who served one term in the U.S. Senate, from 1913 to 1919. Biographical Directory of the U.S. Congress. General Clarence Ransom Edwards (1859-1931) served during the Spanish-American War and WWI. Wikipedia article.

comment._content: Thanks whyaduck! We'll fix the names in the source data and reload the description.
